pros.23: Friendly people that help keep each other motivated. Management that genuinely cares about people development.
pros.24: Ekimo fosters an innovative work environment, encouraging employees to take ownership of their projects and contribute to impactful healthcare solutions. The company emphasizes personal and professional growth, offering opportunities for continuous learning and skill development. Additionally, its focus on scalability and digital health positions employees at the forefront of a rapidly growing industry with exciting challenges.
pros.25: Amazing people, culture and overall a great place to grow. Lots of opportunities!
pros.26:
- Great people, everyone is super nice and you feel like you can be more than just colleagues
- The work is super fun and it is great to work for a wide range of clients in different industries
- Salary is great!
pros.27: Culture excellence office people location remote
pros.28: It is a wonderful place to work with great people, solid values, and a strong culture.
pros.29: Great environment, you learn a lot

cons.1:
- Pressure from management to cut corners on projects for short-term profitability gains at the cost of long-term efficiencies

- Lack of formal technical leadership and dedicated solutions team results in significant project inefficiencies
cons.3: have to me flexible to work on a fast paced environement

Clearly under the market standards in terms of salaries
Some missions can also be quite uninteresting (which is imo normal when working in a consulting company), but the trick is that you need to know the right people internally is you want to work on the best ones, and this is very unlikely to happen within your first 2 years.

cons.23: Projects are mostly Mixed Marketing Modelling related.
cons.24: Due to the fast-paced nature of the health-tech industry, employees may face high-pressure situations and tight deadlines, which can sometimes lead to stress. The growing nature of the company can mean that certain roles may lack well-defined processes, leading to ambiguity in responsibilities. Additionally, balancing work across multiple time zones can create challenges in team coordination and communication.
cons.25: A lot of responsibility, however this is mainly a good thing.
cons.26: - Feels like whether you are good or not, you will pass probation anyways... there can be more structure to evaluating probation such as seeking both upwards and downwards feedback AND actually taking the feedback into consideration and taking some actions...
cons.27: career path visibility work life balance
cons.28: I honestly don't see any cons.
